lessons.title: Introduction to Biology
lessons.description: Explore the basics of biology, the science of life.

pages.title: What is Biology?
pages.description: Learn about the scope and significance of biology.

contentComponents.htmlText: Biology is the natural science that studies life and living organisms.

pages.title: Branches of Biology
pages.description: Understand the different branches of biology.

contentComponents.htmlText: Biology has many branches, including botany, zoology, and microbiology.

pages.title: Tasks
pages.description: Test your knowledge with some questions.

questions.stem: What is the basic unit of life?
Which of these is a branch of biology?
Which organisms are studied in microbiology?
What is the study of plants called?

lessons.title: Basics of Physics
lessons.description: Dive into the world of physics and its fundamental principles.

pages.title: Introduction to Physics
pages.description: Discover the science that explains how the universe behaves.

contentComponents.htmlText: Physics is the science of matter, energy, and the interactions between them.

pages.title: Key Concepts in Physics
pages.description: Learn about fundamental concepts like force, energy, and motion.

contentComponents.htmlText: Force, energy, and motion are central to understanding the physical world.

pages.title: Tasks
pages.description: Evaluate your understanding with some physics questions.

questions.stem: What is the unit of force?
Who is known as the father of modern physics?
What is the speed of light in vacuum?
Which of these is NOT a form of energy?

lessons.title: Introduction to Chemistry
lessons.description: Learn the basics of chemistry, focusing on elements, compounds, and reactions.

pages.title: What is Chemistry?
pages.description: Understand the significance of chemistry in the natural world.

contentComponents.htmlText: Chemistry is the branch of science that studies the composition, structure, properties, and reactions of matter.

pages.title: Elements and Compounds
pages.description: Explore the basic building blocks of matter.

contentComponents.htmlText: An element is a pure substance consisting of only one type of atom, while a compound is formed when two or more elements chemically bond.

pages.title: Tasks
pages.description: Test your chemistry knowledge with these questions.

questions.stem: What is the smallest unit of an element?
Which of these is an example of a compound?
Which element is essential for human life?

lessons.title: Basic Astronomy
lessons.description: Understand the basic concepts of the universe and celestial bodies.

pages.title: What is Astronomy?
pages.description: An overview of the science of celestial objects and phenomena.

contentComponents.htmlText: Astronomy is the study of celestial objects, space, and the universe as a whole.

pages.title: The Solar System
pages.description: Learn about the planets and their characteristics.

contentComponents.htmlText: Our solar system consists of the Sun, eight planets, and other celestial bodies.

pages.title: Tasks
pages.description: Test your knowledge of space and the solar system.

questions.stem: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
What is the largest planet in our solar system?
How many planets are there in our solar system?
